alert.note: Alert for Burke; Columbia; McDuffie; Richmond (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 05 at 5:10PM EDT until April 05 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern McDuffie County in east central Georgia... Southeastern Columbia County in east central Georgia... Burke County in east central Georgia... Richmond County in east central Georgia... Western Barnwell County in central South Carolina... * Until 600 PM EDT. * At 510 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Harlem to 6 miles northwest of Adrian, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... North Augusta, Grovetown, Evans, Waynesboro, Martinez, Fort Gordon, Augusta, Hephzibah, Harlem, Midville, Glendale, Gough, South Augusta, Midtown, Summerville, Augusta Mall, Daniel Field, Augusta Regional Airport, Village Plaza Shopping Center and Augusta National Golf Club. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 188 and 201. Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 1 and 14. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for east central Georgia...and central South Carolina. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Conditions are favorable for tornadoes to form, sometimes with little or no advance warning. Move to an interior room or closet on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. For your protection seek shelter inside a sturdy building and stay away from windows. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for east central Georgia...and central South Carolina.
